meaning_mnemonic: This looks just like a folding <radical>stool</radical>, am I right?

A leaf growing out of a… mouth?? Look again and see the mouth is actually made of <radical>stone</radical>. The leaf here was just growing out of a crack on the side. Makes this stone mouth sculpture look kinda elegant, if you ask me. And obviously leaves don't grow on mouths, so whenever you see a leaf on a mouth, remember it's gotta be stone.

This radical looks like a <radical>spoon</radical>! Well, a spoon that's been bent a lot by an angry person or a psychic. Go grab a spoon and try to bend it into this shape. Then hold on to it so you'll never forget that this is the spoon radical!

This radical looks just like the katakana character "ra" (ラ). The sound "ra" sounds just like the famous Egyptian God "Ra" as well, so we're going to say this radical represents Egypt's God <radical>Ra</radical>.

This is no ordinary enclosure. It is an enclosure with an extra reinforcement (see it sticking out the bottom right of the enclosure radical?). Why is this enclosure reinforced? Because it's the <radical>raptor cage</radical>. I wonder how long they'll be able to hold the raptors... It didn't work out all that well on Jurassic Park...

This is the radical for <radical>winter</radical>. It looks like a skier going downhill (to the left), with their skis out in front and their poles out behind them. And when do people ski? In winter!

You could also remember this as looking like the evening radical but with an extra long stroke, since the evenings are long in winter. It gets dark early in winter, you know?

This looks like a clothesline pole you would <radical>dry</radical> clothes on. It's got two very straight horizontal poles, for maximum drying efficiency. If you were gonna dry your clothes, you'd dry them on this thing.
This is a <radical>canopy</radical>. See the cloth draping down and the little point at the middle holding it up? You could sit under here and enjoy a bright summer day without getting any sun!

This looks like a long index finger bent at the bottom, with several other stubby fingers growing out of it on either side. That makes it the <radical>fingers</radical> radical. A bit creepy, but imagine how easily you could grip something or scratch your back with fingery fingers like these. Pretty nice, right?

This is also a lot like the hand radical (手) but smaller. And what are the smaller parts of a hand? The fingers! You can remember it that way too, if you want.

Take a good look at this one. It kind of looks like a <radical>heart</radical>. Not the heart emoji kind, but a real-deal beating heart. Basically, there's a lump in the middle (the heart), and three lines that make up the arteries. Okay, so it's not the most anatomically correct heart, but just look at those floppy arteries going in and out, doing their thing and keeping you alive. What's not to love?
This radical looks like a dude running off to the right. He's heading in a very distinct <radical>direction</radical>. Which direction was it again?
Do you remember the hair radical? This is like that, except now the hair is attached to a tail. Animals don't usually have hair though. Instead, they have <radical>fur</radical>.

This is the <radical>father</radical> radical, since you can see a very fatherly face in it — two droopy eyes at the top, a big nose in the middle, and a mustache flaring out at the bottom. Sort of a generic older gentleman father-type face, isn't it?

Put a cross over the mouth of a container full of all the <radical>old</radical> things you no longer need. They've all served their purpose but have gotten old, so it's now time to let them rest in peace under the cross. Goodbye, old things!
See the <radical>drawer</radical>? It has two shelves in it with a little nubbin handle on each to let you pull them out. Imagine using this drawer - it'd be pretty oddly shaped.

This looks like a little whiteboard to keep track of your <radical>task</radical>s for the day. It's got three little legs on the bottom. And see those blank squares? They're sticky notes you can write your tasks on. Work tasks, school tasks, WaniKani reviews… So what are your tasks for today? Imagine putting them in those little squares.

This is a gun on top of a big person. The gun is big too, obviously. Why is this big guy's gun so big? Because it shoots <radical>arrow</radical>s! Bullets are pretty small, so the guns that shoot them can be any size. But you need a big gun if you want to shoot a big arrow, right? That's why this is the radical for arrow.

This one looks like a flag, but don't be fooled — it's got a line over the top of it, kind of like a door frame. That makes this a little <radical>door</radical>. Specifically a swinging door, with the vertical line on the left being its door hinge. Kind of a weird door, it's true, but you can see it, right?
This is a <radical>roof</radical> ー a flat roof with a little chimney sticking out. How cute!

For better or worse, this looks enough like the poop emoji (💩) to make this the <radical>poop</radical> radical. Try to remember it for its distinct outline. If it helps you can also note the private radical on the bottom of this one, since you should probably be in private when you poop…

There's something draped over that stick. It's a <radical>towel</radical>! It's the kind of towel you clean with, so it's sort of old and crusty, which is why it holds its square shape even when it's hanging on the stick like that.

See the criss-cross in the almost-square shape? That's the frames of a big <radical>window</radical> you can look out of. It's not perfectly shaped like a rice field, it's more artistic. That's why this is a window and 田 is not.

Remember the radical for drop (of liquid)? Looks like it's shattered into two pieces here, which means it must be <radical>ice</radical> now. You know, since a drop could only break in two after turning into ice.

Remember the sprout from the dirt radical? This looks like that, but wait a minute… there's some extra growth now! This thing is so full of <radical>life</radical>! It's even got a big, slide-shaped leaf growing on the top left. That's why it's the life radical.

This is the radical for <radical>now</radical>. It's a bit tough to see, but it kind of looks like a fancy clock. The 𠆢 is the top part hanging over the clock. The ラ shows a triangular clock face with a little cuckoo on top, peeking out to tell you this means now — right now!

You only have some ice and a stick for your spoon, because you're way up north. At the top of the world, there's only ice to eat, and — if you're lucky — a bit of stick for flavor. That's the <radical>north</radical> for you.
The sun AND the moon are out? With both their light-powers combined, it's incredibly <radical>bright</radical> outside.

This looks like the guy from the big radical, but he's got something extra on his belly. That's his exposed belly button, because he's a sumo wrestler now: big and <radical>fat</radical>. In sumo, more fat means more power, so imagine he's been training to get as strong and fat as possible.
Do you know those rice paddy hats? The ones shaped just like this radical? That's why this radical is a <radical>hat</radical>.
The three horns represent the <radical>triceratops</radical>, one of the most awesome dinosaurs ever.
